It's a very nice puzzle game. Some of the puzzles were a bit challenging, and I have to admit i looked up one or two solutions. The story is engaging. I'm left feeling a bit solemn and frustrated that I can't have a conversation with GlaDOS. Maybe we could work it out.
great puzzle game. a must own game

To be honest, this game is the best game I've played in my entire gaming career since 2016 (currently typing on this account due to the old account being banned). I don't know how to thank the developers of the game, Portal 2 reduced my fear
and much more making me a much better person, I don't care if it is repetitive this game still remains fun even with friends, whenever I will be pretty much paranoid or scared for future stuff I just know that this is the key to relax myself
from anything coming.
My favorite game I played it too much, man I wonder how much money I made for testing probably in the millions I'm guessing.
Sorry, just came here for the cake, er I mean comments.

This game takes the the things that made the original so good and adds more of it. The puzzles are more complex, rooms are bigger, and the dialogue is more clever (especially since now you have to Ai to keep you entertained). This is a must play game and i highly recommend it.

[h1]Go buy the [b]Portal bundle[/b]!! Play [i]Portal: Still Alive[/i], and then come back and play [i]Portal 2[/i][/h1]

If, for some reason, you're still here... Portal 2 is the brilliant sequel to the already beloved Portal: Still Alive. It's best described as a FPP (First Person Puzzler) interlaced with an amazing character driven story that'll pull you in and keep you going to the end.

And if you've got a friend, there's even more!! With the addition of a coop mode containing a whole separate campaign following the aftermath of the single-player story (Don't worry, it doesn't really spoil anything, but I'd still play SP first).

Having finished that too you might wonder what else is there? Well we've got the Steam Workshop, full of player submitted maps and mini-campaigns that could keep you (and a partner) engaged for hours to come.

Honestly, if you're still reading this, go buy the whole Portal bundle and try it out for yourself.

(Disclaimer: I spent most of my play time with this series on the Xbox 360)
